titleStmt.title: James Edward Smith, Norwich, [Norfolk], to Alexander Macleay

seriesStmt.ab: The Correspondence of Sir James Edward Smith, The Linnean Society's Archive Catalogue

sourceDesc.bibl: GB-110/JES/AM/80, The Linnean Society of London

abstract.p: Congratulates Macleay on the recovery of his daughter's health. Encloses paper received in a packet for Linnean Society. He is so "very pressed" by Rees' "Cyclopedia" and third part of "Florae Graecae prodromus" he is unable to do anything else, and has cancelled a trip to Holkham [Hall, home of Thomas William Coke]. William Smith to sleep here tonight after his election victory, "not so much that of a party man as a good man", both Norwich members now FLS [other member Charles Harvey].
Thanks [William George] Maton for prescription of "powdered chamomile flowers" for his autumnal headaches.
